jobs.title: Sr. Director, Global Sports Marketing - HOKA
jobs.excerpt: At Deckers Brands, Together, Every Step is a promise kept that every employee can bring their authentic self, is valued and supported, as a whole person, at work and beyond.
jobs.description:
At Deckers Brands, Together, Every Step is a promise kept that every employee can bring their authentic self, is valued and supported, as a whole person, at work and beyond. Together, Every Step is how we continue to deliver exceptional business results, experience an amazing place to work, and have a positive impact on the communities and world around us.

Job Title: Sr. Director, Global Sports Marketing - HOKA

Reports to: VP Global Marketing - HOKA

Location: Remote - West Coast preferred (LA, Santa Barbara, or Portland, OR)

Interested applicants must reside in one of the following approved states:

Arizona, California, Colorado, Indiana, Massachusetts, Minnesota, New York, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Texas, Utah, Washington

The Role

At HOKA, we are committed to pushing the boundaries of performance and innovation in athletic footwear and apparel. As the Senior Director of Global Sports Marketing, you will have the opportunity to shape our brand’s presence in the running and wider sports industry, drive meaningful partnerships, and lead impactful marketing initiatives globally. Join us in our mission to defy convention and inspire a world of athletes to fly over the Earth.

Senior Director of Global Sports Marketing will lead our worldwide sports marketing initiatives. In this role, you will drive the development and execution of comprehensive sports marketing strategies to enhance brand awareness, elevate athlete partnerships, and strengthen HOKA’s global presence in the sports industry. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to create impactful campaigns that resonate with athletes, consumers and in culture around the world while amplifying our brand message and strengthening our position in the market.

We celebrate diversity--of your background, your experiences and your unique identity. We are committed to ensuring an inclusive and equitable workplace where all of our employees can Come as They Are. We believe that when we bring our different perspectives to work, we are truly Better Together.

Your Impact

The primary functions of this role, include but are not limited to:

Build Global Sports Marketing Strategy:

  • Lead the strategic development and implementation of integrated global sports marketing plans aligned with HOKA’s brand vision and business objectives.
  • Attract and retain athletes that power HOKA’s priority areas of focus including Road Running, Track and Field and Trail.

Foster Athlete and Team Partnerships:

  • Cultivate and manage relationships with top athletes, teams, and sports federations globally to enhance HOKA’s brand visibility and credibility.
  • Deliver best in class athlete services and negotiate and oversee endorsement contracts and partnerships that align with HOKA’s brand values and audiences.

Campaign Planning and Execution:

  • Collaborate with global marketing, creative, and digital teams to develop and execute integrated sports marketing campaigns that drive global brand awareness, engagement, and sales.

Leadership and Team Development:

  • Provide visionary leadership to the global sports marketing team, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence. Be a steward for DEI internally and across our athlete roster.
  • Mentor and develop team members, empowering them to achieve their full potential and contribute to HOKA’s overall success.
  • Guide and inspire regional counterparts to execute global sports marketing vision and strategies.

Who You Are

Strong marketing leader who’s known for inspiring teams with optimism, passion and vision. Strategic, artful negotiator and relationship builder who has a love for sport and building iconic brands.

We’d love to hear from people with

  • Experience: Minimum of 15 years of progressive experience in sports marketing, with specialty in the running world, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role within a global sports brand or related industry.
  • Global Perspective: Strong understanding of international markets, cultural nuances, and global sports trends.
  • Industry Knowledge: Deep understanding of the sports industry and running landscape, trends, key stakeholders, and consumer behaviors. Includes understanding and experience at the intersection of sport and global culture.
  • Strategic Vision: Proven ability to develop and execute global sports marketing strategies that drive brand growth, market share and cultural relevance.
  • Relationship Management: Established network of relationships with international athletes, sports teams, federations, and industry influencers.
  • Communication Skills: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively influence and inspire internal and external stakeholders across diverse cultures and regions.
  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical mindset with proficiency in data analysis, performance metrics, and ROI measurement.
  • Leadership: Demonstrated leadership capabilities, with a track record of building and leading high-performing teams in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
  • Education: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.

What We'll Give You

  • Competitive Pay and Bonuses - We’ve created a variety of competitive compensation programs to foster career development, reward success and to show our employees just how much they’re valued.
  • Financial Planning and wellbeing - No matter what financial goals our employees have set, we want to help them get there. Our plans provide powerful ways to protect income, pay for expenses and invest in the future.
  • Time away from work - Sometimes we need time away to be with family, focus on our health or just simply recharge. Our plans support our employees’ needs to get out, get healthy and come back stronger than ever.
  • Extras, discounts and perks - Being a valued member of the Deckers Brands team means more than just a paycheck. From generous discounts to community-based programs, we offer a variety of cool extras
  • Growth and Development - Deckers Brands was built on the idea of pursuing passion. That’s why we offer extensive opportunities and support for personal and professional development.
  • Health and Wellness - There’s nothing basic about our comprehensive health and wellness programs and offerings. While at work and at play, we aim to support a healthy lifestyle.

$230,000 - $250,000

The salary range posted reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for this role in our Goleta, CA location. Individual pay will be determined by location and additional factors, including job related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Equal Employment Opportunity
Diversity and inclusion are key to our success. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and our employees are people with different strengths, experiences and backgrounds who share a passion for our brands. We welcome qualified applicants regardless of their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, military or veteran status, mental or physical disability, medical condition and all of the other beautiful parts of your identity.

Originally posted on Himalayas

jobs.title: Chief Financial Officer
jobs.excerpt: About OffSecFounded in 2007 by the creators of Kali Linux, OffSec (formerly known as Offensive Security) is the leading provider of continuous professional and workforce development, training, and education for cybersecurity practitioners.
jobs.description:
About OffSec

Founded in 2007 by the creators of Kali Linux, OffSec (formerly known as Offensive Security) is the leading provider of continuous professional and workforce development, training, and education for cybersecurity practitioners. OffSec’s distinct pedagogy and practical, hands-on learning help organizations fill the infosec talent gap by training their teams on today’s most critical skills.

Become a part of our global presence and work from anywhere. With team members in over 40 countries, we believe in inspiring people of all backgrounds and communities. The OffSec team is composed of diverse, internationally published authors, conference speakers, and seasoned information technology professionals from both the private sector and governments worldwide.

Excited about our mission and what we do? Apply and join us!

About the Job

Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO), the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) is part of the senior executive team. The CFO will lead OffSec’s finance, legal, and co-lead HR with the CEO. The CFO will be responsible for managing the financial operations of the company, focusing on key operational and financial metrics, overseeing financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, cash flow management, and aligning financial strategies with company growth strategy to ensure sustainable and profitable growth. The CFO will use a data-driven approach to optimize for pricing, customer acquisitions, and revenue generation initiatives, as well as operational efficiency. The CFO will work closely with the sales team for deal support, and will also work closely with the Board for various reporting needs.

Duties and responsibilities

Financial Planning and Analysis

Develop financial models, forecasts, and budgets to track performance against strategic goals, including managing cash flow and identifying potential risks

Revenue Optimization

Analyze revenue by product and by customer types to understand customer acquisition costs, customer retention rates, and pricing strategies to maximize revenue growth and optimize customer lifetime value

Metric Monitoring

Develop insightful KPIs to know the health of the business and where improvement opportunities lie, including metrics such as customer acquisition cost (CAC), customer lifetime value (LTV), net dollar retention, unit cost of various operational functions

Strategic Decision Making

Be an active contributor to develop company growth strategies. Collaborate with the executive team to develop and implement financial strategies that align with the company's overall business objectives.

Board Relations

Prepare financial presentations and reports for the board, manage relationships with financial services providers, and support fundraising activities when needed

Compliance and Reporting

Ensure adherence to financial regulations and accounting standards, oversee financial reporting processes, and produce accurate financial statements

Team Management

Lead the finance team, including accounting, budgeting, and analysis functions, and develop talent within the department. Build and foster relationships across multiple cross-functional teams

Skills and Qualifications

Experience

  • Enterprise B2B - 10+ years of experience as a finance leader in a fast growing B2B enterprise sales-focused software business
  • Recurring Revenue - in depth, hands-on experience with key metrics for a SaaS or recurring business model, such as customer acquisition cost, churn, retention, net and gross dollar retention
  • Global sales - 10+ years of leading financial operations for a business with global operations with an international sales motion including B2B sales, government sales, and partner and channel sales
  • Analytics - extremely analytical, capable of collecting and analyzing the key data to gain insights to guide the business for revenue optimization and margin improvements
  • Strategic - a strategic thinker, able to learn fast about a new industry and business, and have been an active contributor to develop company strategy as a senior financial leader
  • FPA - strong background in FPA, with hands-on experience managing FPA in large and growing B2B software and/or SaaS companies
  • Hands-on - able to deep dive deeply into the business and work with the finance and accounting teams and other cross-functional teams in a hands-on, roll-up-the-sleeves fashion
  • B2C - A great nice-to-have experience running B2C businesses as a financial leader
  • Leadership - a great leader that will develop the teams and be a peer to collaborate with the rest of the executive team(s), embracing a growth mindset, striking the right balance between business and people, and leading by example
  • MA - experience evaluating and executing on expansion via acquisitions including post-acquisition integration
  • Bonus points - if the candidate has worked in a private equity-backed company focusing on strong EBITDA growth or in the cybersecurity industry.

Technical Expertise

  • Highly proficient with excel, Google drive tools, capable of building financial models hands-on or providing detailed guidance to teams
  • Highly analytical, capable of extracting actionable insights from vast amount of data
  • Experienced in developing financial and operational KPIs that indicate the health of business, and areas for improvements
  • Able to deep dive with teams to enable goal achievement, and to proactively identify signals for potential forecast risks to facilitate necessary corrections

Leadership

  • A strategic thinker with hands-on execution skills and the ability to lead from the front.
  • Expertise in providing a vision for what must be done, winning the support to execute the vision and managing to achieve established business objectives.
  • Capable of executing short-term (tactical) and long-term (strategic) plans.
  • Experience managing and inspiring globally distributed teams in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.
  • Setting clear and measurable performance objectives and monitoring progress rigorously, planning, and linking action to business priorities

Other Attributes

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with a collaborative mindset.
  • Passion for building communities and engaging with a global user base.
  • Self-secured/confident executive, but not arrogant
  • Ambitious and growth oriented who is intellectually curious
  • High level of emotional intelligence and can gain the credibility and respect of others

Why Join OffSec?

OffSec is a fast-growing, profitable, and market-leading cybersecurity training and certification company, with a unique blend of enterprise and direct-to-consumer sales motions. The company is poised for continued tremendous growth and offers the opportunity to shape its finance function into a best-in-class operation. As CFO, you will play a pivotal role in scaling the company to new heights and expanding its impact worldwide.

Working conditions

This role is a full-time salaried position. Work hours for this position are flexible and will be performed from a home office.

Direct reports

This position will have multiple direct reports.

EEO

OffSec provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Originally posted on Himalayas

jobs.title: Director of Talent Development
jobs.excerpt: Director of Talent DevelopmentThe Director of Talent Development will lead and scale a high-impact team focused on Talent Development, Talent Acquisition, and Employee Experience at Techstars.
jobs.description:
Director of Talent Development

The Director of Talent Development will lead and scale a high-impact team focused on Talent Development, Talent Acquisition, and Employee Experience at Techstars. This role is responsible for designing and executing innovative, people-first programs that drive engagement, inclusion, and business success. The ideal candidate will be a strategic and hands-on leader, with a passion for progressive HR practices, leadership development, and data-driven decision-making.

This position requires a deep understanding of talent acquisition, learning development, and employee engagement strategies that align with Techstars’ mission. The Director of Talent Development will develop and implement tailored solutions to attract, retain, and develop top talent across a high-growth, global organization.

Responsibilities and Duties:

Talent Acquisition Onboarding

  • Lead the talent acquisition team, ensuring a seamless recruitment process that attracts top talent aligned with Techstars’ values and mission.
  • Oversee and enhance the onboarding experience, ensuring new hires integrate smoothly and feel engaged from day one.

Talent Development Learning

  • Design and manage peer learning programs to foster knowledge sharing and professional growth.
  • Develop and implement leadership development initiatives, training programs, and performance coaching strategies.
  • Establish and oversee Techstars' Leadership Forum, providing leaders with the insights, tools, and resources needed to enhance their impact.

Employee Experience People Analytics

  • Develop and track People Culture metrics, providing actionable insights to improve engagement, retention, and performance.
  • Design and implement employee engagement surveys, analyze results, and drive data-backed improvements.
  • Oversee performance and development cycles, ensuring a continuous feedback culture and clear career progression opportunities.

Lifecycle Processes Functional Project Management

  • Own and enhance employee lifecycle processes, ensuring consistency and effectiveness.
  • Lead cross-functional projects to improve People Culture policies, processes, and overall employee experience.
  • Manage the People Culture Slack channel, fostering open communication, knowledge sharing, and transparency across the organization.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 7+ years of experience in Talent Development, Learning Development, HR, or a related field.
  • Proven track record in designing and executing talent development programs, employee engagement initiatives, and performance management strategies.
  • Experience managing and scaling high-impact teams in fast-paced, high-growth environments.
  • Strong analytical skills with experience using People Culture metrics to drive decision-making in a dynamic and rapidly evolving environment.
  • Excellent project management skills, with the ability to oversee multiple initiatives simultaneously.
  • Ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels, including executive leadership and cross-functional teams.

Preferred Experience:

  • Experience working with global teams and scaling people strategies across multiple regions.
  • Familiarity with progressive HR practices, leadership development, and inclusive hiring strategies.

Compensation: $135,000 - $145,000 with 10% bonus

Colorado Residents: In any materials you submit, you may redact or remove age-identifying information such as age, date of birth, or dates of school attendance or graduation. You will not be penalized for redacting or removing this information.

About Techstars

Techstars is the most active pre-seed investor in the world having invested through its accelerators in more than 4,800 companies. Founded in 2006, Techstars believes that entrepreneurs create a better future for everyone and great ideas can come from anywhere. Now we are on a mission to invest in an unprecedented number of startups per year enabling more capital to flow to more entrepreneurs around the world. We do this by operating accelerator programs and venture capital funds, as well as by connecting startups, investors, corporations, and cities to help build thriving startup communities. www.techstars.com

Techstars is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, age, national origin, religion, physical or mental handicaps or disabilities, marital status, Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity nor any other basis prohibited by law.

Techstars uses E-Verify to check the work authorization of all new hires. For more information about E-Verify, please see the following:

E-Verify Participation Poster (English and Spanish)

Right To Work Poster (English and Spanish)
